intro: Denisophytum, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a single, erect stem that bears a single flower head. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Denisophytum species are generally small, herbaceous plants with narrow, linear leaves and yellow or orange disk flowers. These plants are adapted to withstand drought conditions, making them resilient in harsh environments.
